How can I use the `sendcurrency` API in Verus to send and convert funds?

The `sendcurrency` API in Verus can be used to send and convert funds in various ways. For example, you can send VRSCTEST from a single address to a single recipient:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'
```
Or, you can send VRSCTEST from all private wallet funds to two recipients with friendly-name z-addresses:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*Z" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@:private","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@:private","amount":10}]'
```
You can also convert VRSCTEST to a fractional basket currency, VRSC-BTC using IDs as a funding source:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*i" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'
```
Or, convert VRSCTEST to another reserve, BTC through a fractional currency, VRSC-BTC:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'
```
Additionally, you can preconvert to a new currency, NEWCOIN, before it is active:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refund":true}]'
```
